meanings.sent1: The motile fish swam swiftly in the water.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah is a motile animal, known for its speed.
meanings.sent3: The motile squirrel raced up the tree to escape the playful dog.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were motile, darting from one idea to the next.
meanings.sent5: The motile clouds drifted lazily across the sky, changing shapes constantly.

meanings.definition: Moving or able to move from place to place
meanings.sent1: The motile robot navigated through the maze with ease.
meanings.sent2: Birds are motile creatures, flying freely in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The motile toy car zipped around the room, delighting the children.
meanings.sent4: His imagination was motile, exploring different worlds in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The motile ants formed a line, carrying food back to their nest efficiently.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to move independently
meanings.sent1: The motile amoeba extended its pseudopods to capture prey.
meanings.sent2: Snakes are motile reptiles, slithering across the ground.
meanings.sent3: The motile robot danced gracefully, showcasing its agility.
meanings.sent4: His words were motile, persuading the audience with every sentence.
meanings.sent5: The motile caterpillar transformed into a beautiful butterfly, fluttering away.
